events.originalText: Citing rocket attacks from Palestinian armed groups, Israel launched a surprise attack against the Gaza Strip, opening the three-week Gaza War.
events.subtitle: Qassam rocket
events.headline: Israel launches surprise attack on Gaza Strip, starting three-week Gaza War

events.originalText: Former prime minister Benazir Bhutto was assassinated while leaving a Pakistan Peoples Party political rally at Liaqat National Bagh in Rawalpindi.
events.subtitle: Benazir Bhutto
events.headline: Former prime minister Benazir Bhutto assassinated in Rawalpindi

events.originalText: Riots erupted in Mombasa, Kenya, after Mwai Kibaki was declared the winner of the presidential election—the first event in a political, economic, and humanitarian crisis.
events.subtitle: Mombasa
events.headline: Riots erupt in Mombasa after Mwai Kibaki declared winner of presidential election

events.originalText: The human-cloning company Clonaid claimed to have performed the first reproductive cloning of a human, but provided no evidence for the claim.
events.subtitle: Human cloning
events.headline: Clonaid claims first human reproductive cloning with no evidence

events.originalText: Loyalist Volunteer Force leader Billy Wright was assassinated in HM Prison Maze by members of the Irish National Liberation Army.
events.subtitle: Loyalist Volunteer Force
events.headline: Loyalist Volunteer Force leader Billy Wright assassinated in HM Prison Maze

events.originalText: The body of murdered American primatologist Dian Fossey was discovered inside her cabin in Volcanoes National Park, Rwanda.
events.subtitle: Primatology
events.headline: Body of murdered primatologist Dian Fossey found in Volcanoes National Park

events.originalText: Soviet–Afghan War: Soviet troops stormed Tajbeg Palace outside Kabul and killed Afghan president Hafizullah Amin and his 100–150 elite guards.
events.subtitle: Soviet–Afghan War
events.headline: Soviet troops storm Tajbeg Palace, killing Afghan president Hafizullah Amin

events.originalText: New York City's Radio City Music Hall opened with the world's largest auditorium at the time.
events.subtitle: Radio City Music Hall
events.headline: Radio City Music Hall opens in New York City with world's largest auditorium

events.originalText: Joseph Stalin announced the "liquidation of the kulaks as a class", beginning a period of political repression against prosperous peasants.
events.subtitle: Joseph Stalin
events.headline: Joseph Stalin announces liquidation of kulaks as a class, starting political repression

events.originalText: The Imperial Japanese Navy commissioned Hōshō (pictured), the world's first purpose-built aircraft carrier.
events.subtitle: Imperial Japanese Navy
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Navy commissions world's first purpose-built aircraft carrier, Hōshō

events.originalText: A public speech by the Polish pianist Ignacy Jan Paderewski in Poznań sparked the Greater Poland uprising against Germany.
events.subtitle: Ignacy Jan Paderewski
events.headline: Polish pianist Ignacy Jan Paderewski sparks Greater Poland uprising in Poznań

events.originalText: The stage play Peter Pan; or, The Boy Who Wouldn't Grow Up, by Scottish author J. M. Barrie, premiered in London.
events.subtitle: Peter and Wendy
events.headline: Peter Pan stage play by J. M. Barrie premieres in London

events.originalText: HMS Beagle departed Plymouth, England, on a voyage to South America that established Charles Darwin's standing as a naturalist.
events.subtitle: HMS Beagle
events.headline: HMS Beagle departs on voyage to South America, establishing Charles Darwin's standing

events.originalText: Citizens of New Netherland presented the Flushing Remonstrance to Peter Stuyvesant, the director general of the colonial province, requesting an exemption to his ban on Quaker worship.
events.subtitle: New Netherland
events.headline: Flushing Remonstrance presented to Peter Stuyvesant in New Netherland

events.originalText: A period of unrest in Wittenberg following the arrival of three men of the Radical Reformation, known as the Zwickau prophets, was quelled after Martin Luther's release from custody.
events.subtitle: Wittenberg
events.headline: Unrest in Wittenberg quelled after Zwickau prophets, Martin Luther's release

events.originalText: The reconstructed Hagia Sophia (pictured) in Constantinople was inaugurated; built as a church, it later became a mosque and a museum.
events.subtitle: Hagia Sophia
events.headline: Reconstructed Hagia Sophia in Constantinople inaugurated as mosque and museum
